answers.answer: I dont think anything causes it that is my biggest fear!!! Is having a stillborn..
I believe smoking effects your chances of having a stillborn , but other than there's really nothing .
My parents were going to adopt a baby , and she ended up being a stillborn because her biological mother smoked her whole pregnancy
Yes it is! I wonder do they notice anything différent threw an ultrasound
If your baby is in distress they do .
How do you know if they are distressed?
I know that diabetes can but idk what stage

Once you're well into your 3rd trimester , and you're supposed to feel normal movements , if you don't feel at least 10 movements in 2 hour period laying on your side after drinking juice , and having a sugary snack then there's a possibility that's what's going on . But baby's don't go into distress unless they aren't getting the correct nutrients from the placenta .
I was scared bout that. But u can't drive your mind crazy thinking like that.even tho it is Normal
Ive never thought of that now uve got me thinking dont like thinking about these things its probably the worse thing that can happen to you positive thought ladies. Happy thoughts happy baby!
I don't really know the causes but sometimes the umbilical cord gets wrapped around their neck...its really sad just thinking about it!

My first baby girl was a stillborn at 4 1\2 months I lost her last year in March its one of the hardest things ever. The doctor did test on her and on me and everything was normal its just something that happened naturally. Still makes me sad till this day. Now I'm 7 months pregnant with my rainbow baby and it's a girl everything is going fine THANK GOD!!!
Its scary! But we have to be positive!
They are inducing me at 39 weeks if I don't pop before hand because in any case of preexisting diabetes you have a higher chance of a still birth at 39 weeks or farther

question: I've been reading a lot of woman having   stillborns, what causes that?
title: what causes a stillborn???
